item.title: Report X-2024121184
item.description:
Report X-2024121184

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FedEx repack box found wet and torn when loading OB trailer. When Package handler indicated having skin irritation from contact with the package and its contents, product SDS was looked up and found to be a Hazardous Material Class 8 PG III. 4-1gal plastic bottles of Champion Acid Blue Next Generation Muriatic Acid in individual plastic bags inside 16"x16"x16" box and no additional packing material. Outer box had no markings. 1 bottle was found to have a crack in the seam under the handle causing it to spill acid into the box. Original shipment images show bottles in product box with printed Limited Quantity diamond and printed directional arrows.

Original shipment images show bottles in product box with printed Limited Quantity diamond and printed directional arrows.

item.title: Report E-2024120318
item.description:
Report E-2024120318

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12530
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A valve on the KAG Specialty Products, LLC trailer was not closed properly. This allowed approximately 15 gallons of molten sulphur to be released. Alpha and Omega Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
